temples.title: Angkor Wat
temples.summary: The iconic heart of Angkor—an immense temple-mountain surrounded by moats and causeways.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Built in the Khmer imperial era, Angkor Wat blends grand symmetry with detailed bas‑reliefs and soaring towers. Originally Hindu and later Buddhist, it remains Cambodia’s most celebrated monument.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Visitors come for sunrise reflections in the moat, kilometer‑long reliefs of epics and history, and the central quincunx of towers that symbolizes Mount Meru.

temples.title: Bayon
temples.summary: A mesmerizing maze of towers carved with serene faces at the center of Angkor Thom.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Bayon is famed for its multitude of smiling stone faces and vivid bas‑reliefs depicting daily life and battles. It served as a state temple during a late Angkor period.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Narrow corridors, elevated terraces, and clusters of face‑towers create shifting perspectives that reward slow exploration and close observation.

temples.title: Banteay Srei
temples.summary: A small but exquisite temple renowned for pink sandstone and jewel‑like carvings.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Nicknamed the 'Citadel of Women', Banteay Srei showcases some of the most intricate stone carvings in the Angkor region.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Its compact layout, warm sandstone tones, and delicate lintels and pediments make it ideal for close‑up photography and study of Khmer ornament.

temples.title: Ta Keo
temples.summary: A stark, unfinished mountain temple of massive sandstone blocks and steep stairways.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Ta Keo’s clean lines and lack of decoration highlight its bold, pyramidal form. It offers a glimpse of monumental construction mid‑process.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Climbing the steep tiers gives wide views and reveals how Khmer architects stacked huge courses to evoke the cosmic mountain.

temples.title: Preah Vihear
temples.summary: A dramatic cliff‑top temple straddling the Dangrek escarpment with sweeping views.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Laid out along a long axis that ascends through a series of gopuras, Preah Vihear rewards visitors with both architecture and horizon.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Its sequence of terraces and sanctuaries culminates near the cliff edge, making the journey itself part of the experience.

temples.title: Banteay Samre
temples.summary: A refined Angkor Wat–style temple set amid quiet laterite walls and courtyards.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Banteay Samre features balanced proportions, well‑preserved galleries, and a harmonious ensemble of towers and enclosures.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: The inner courtyard and cruciform terraces showcase elegant Khmer detailing that photographers love in soft afternoon light.

temples.title: Preah Khan
temples.summary: A sprawling monastic complex of corridors, libraries, and tree‑shaded courtyards.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Preah Khan functioned as a Buddhist center with space for learning and ceremony, later incorporating Hindu elements.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Long, atmospheric passageways, boundary stones, and delicate carvings invite exploration much like its famous sibling Ta Prohm—without the same crowds.

temples.title: Pre Rup
temples.summary: A brick‑and‑laterite temple‑mountain often praised for warm sunset tones.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Pre Rup’s tiered pyramid and central sanctuary echo the cosmic mountain theme central to Khmer sacred architecture.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Its brick towers and laterite platforms glow at day’s end, while steep stairways lead to broad views over the surrounding plain.

temples.title: Phnom Bakheng
temples.summary: A hilltop state temple offering panoramic views over Angkor and the surrounding forest.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Phnom Bakheng is one of Angkor’s earliest major temples, built on a natural hill to align city, kingship, and sacred geography.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: The ascent rewards with vistas toward Angkor Wat and Tonlé Sap, making it a popular spot in the golden hour.

temples.title: Preah Ko
temples.summary: An early Angkor monument at Roluos noted for graceful brick towers and sandstone detail.

descriptions.label: Overview
descriptions.text: Named for the sacred bull, Preah Ko honors royal ancestors and showcases early Khmer brickwork with stucco traces.

descriptions.label: Details
descriptions.text: Trioed front towers, elegant lintels, and guardian statues mark a foundational moment in Khmer temple design.
